programme.title: Malcolm u sredini
programme.desc: Malcolm, srednje dijete s genijalnim kvocijentom inteligencije, suočava se s borbama i izazovima svakodnevnog života, zajedno sa svojom disfunkcionalnom obitelji. Malcolm ne želi da ga doživljavaju kao štrebera, ali Lois ga posrami u školi. Reese maltretira druge, čak se potuče s kozom u zoološkom vrtu. Francis se suočava sa zlim kravama na farmi. Dewey nastupi u predstavi na koju njegova obitelj ne dođe.

The relationship formed between the two leads is unquestionably one of the best and is, so far, most endearing. It is impossible to not like them.

Move over David Boreanaz 'cause Nathan has got you beat in the plucky-comedic-male-sidekick-to-tough-and-serious-female-cop role. Nathan comes off as the friend we all want and treasure. Having followed Nathan's career rather closely I am glad to see him in this role. It fits his nature and you can tell he knows it too just by watching him. It's in his postures and mannerisms and facial expressions. I believe he said in an interview that he is "72%" this character and that sounds about right. He is comfortable in this role. Similar to how he was comfortable when playing Malcom Reynolds in "Firefly"(which, by the way, is the greatest show of all time...period).

Then there is Stana Katic, who plays Detective Kate Beckett, and God is she gorgeous and enticing. No wonder Nathan's character can't get enough of her. Stana manages to instill in the portrayal of her character enough grit and fortitude to be mysterious and alluring, while retaining a good amount of the audiences confidence in her ability to be a bad-ass. On the other side, though, she is beautiful and her lightly-flirtatious nature does not detract from the other part of her character but rather enriches it making her feel real rather than just a cliché tough female cop(because TV is full of them right now).

What it comes down to, ladies and gentlemen, is chemistry and these two have it. They are a joy to watch even when they are not in scenes together and that is what will keep viewers tuning in each week. This show has great promise.

Before I go I will note that it was nice to see real authors on the show(I will not reveal who). It adds another layer to Castle's character and makes for an amusing poker scene. I hope the producers arrange for more cameos of this nature.

IMDb data; ttnr: 1219024, Title: Castle, --- Description: Castle: Created by Andrew W. Marlowe. With Nathan Fillion, Stana Katic, Susan Sullivan, Jon Huertas. After a serial killer imitates the plots of his novels, successful mystery novelist Richard "Rick" Castle receives permission from the Mayor of New York City to tag along with an NYPD homicide investigation team for research purposes." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt1219024/","name":"Castle","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjM2NjU0ODU0NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMDAwMzg5NjE@._V1_.jpg","description":"After a serial killer imitates the plots of his novels, successful mystery novelist Richard "Rick" Castle receives permission from the Mayor of New York City to tag along with an NYPD homicide investigation team for research purposes","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1219024/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"jamylie","dateCreated":"2009-03-10","inLanguage":"English","name":"Ah, a Breath of Fresh Air.","reviewBody":"The pilot episode for ABC's new crime show "Castle" left me wanting more, much more in fact, and that is exactly what a good pilot should do. The relationship formed between the two leads is unquestionably one of the best and is, so far, most endearing. It is impossible to not like them.

I'll start with Nathan Fillion(of "Firefly" fame). Nathan plays Richard 'Rick' Castle. His charm and wit and spot-on comedic delivery make him alone the reason to tune in each week. Move over David Boreanaz 'cause Nathan has got you beat in the plucky-comedic-male-sidekick-to-tough-and-serious-female-cop role. Nathan comes off as the friend we all want and treasure. Having followed Nathan's career rather closely I am glad to see him in this role. It fits his nature and you can tell he knows it too just by watching him. It's in his postures and mannerisms and facial expressions. I believe he said in an interview that he is "72%" this character and that sounds about right. He is comfortable in this role. Similar to how he was comfortable when playing Malcom Reynolds in "Firefly"(which, by the way, is the greatest show of all time...period).

Then there is Stana Katic, who plays Detective Kate Beckett, and God is she gorgeous and enticing. No wonder Nathan's character can't get enough of her. Stana manages to instill in the portrayal of her character enough grit and fortitude to be mysterious and alluring, while retaining a good amount of the audiences confidence in her ability to be a bad-ass. On the other side, though, she is beautiful and her lightly-flirtatious nature does not detract from the other part of her character but rather enriches it making her feel real rather than just a cliché tough female cop(because TV is full of them right now).

What it comes down to, ladies and gentlemen, is chemistry and these two have it. They are a joy to watch even when they are not in scenes together and that is what will keep viewers tuning in each week. This show has great promise.

Before I go I will note that it was nice to see real authors on the show(I will not reveal who). It adds another layer to Castle's character and makes for an amusing poker scene. I hope the producers arrange for more cameos of this nature.

IMDb data; ttnr: 1219024, Title: Castle, --- Description: Castle: Created by Andrew W. Marlowe. With Nathan Fillion, Stana Katic, Susan Sullivan, Jon Huertas. After a serial killer imitates the plots of his novels, successful mystery novelist Richard "Rick" Castle receives permission from the Mayor of New York City to tag along with an NYPD homicide investigation team for research purposes." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt1219024/","name":"Castle","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjM2NjU0ODU0NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMDAwMzg5NjE@._V1_.jpg","description":"After a serial killer imitates the plots of his novels, successful mystery novelist Richard "Rick" Castle receives permission from the Mayor of New York City to tag along with an NYPD homicide investigation team for research purposes","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1219024/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"jamylie","dateCreated":"2009-03-10","inLanguage":"English","name":"Ah, a Breath of Fresh Air.","reviewBody":"The pilot episode for ABC's new crime show "Castle" left me wanting more, much more in fact, and that is exactly what a good pilot should do. The relationship formed between the two leads is unquestionably one of the best and is, so far, most endearing. It is impossible to not like them.

I'll start with Nathan Fillion(of "Firefly" fame). Nathan plays Richard 'Rick' Castle. His charm and wit and spot-on comedic delivery make him alone the reason to tune in each week. Move over David Boreanaz 'cause Nathan has got you beat in the plucky-comedic-male-sidekick-to-tough-and-serious-female-cop role. Nathan comes off as the friend we all want and treasure. Having followed Nathan's career rather closely I am glad to see him in this role. It fits his nature and you can tell he knows it too just by watching him. It's in his postures and mannerisms and facial expressions. I believe he said in an interview that he is "72%" this character and that sounds about right. He is comfortable in this role. Similar to how he was comfortable when playing Malcom Reynolds in "Firefly"(which, by the way, is the greatest show of all time...period).

Then there is Stana Katic, who plays Detective Kate Beckett, and God is she gorgeous and enticing. No wonder Nathan's character can't get enough of her. Stana manages to instill in the portrayal of her character enough grit and fortitude to be mysterious and alluring, while retaining a good amount of the audiences confidence in her ability to be a bad-ass. On the other side, though, she is beautiful and her lightly-flirtatious nature does not detract from the other part of her character but rather enriches it making her feel real rather than just a cliché tough female cop(because TV is full of them right now).

What it comes down to, ladies and gentlemen, is chemistry and these two have it. They are a joy to watch even when they are not in scenes together and that is what will keep viewers tuning in each week. This show has great promise.

Before I go I will note that it was nice to see real authors on the show(I will not reveal who). It adds another layer to Castle's character and makes for an amusing poker scene. I hope the producers arrange for more cameos of this nature.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: Kako bi se razriješili brojni zločini, tu je ekipa za očevid CSI: Miami. Pred njima se nalaze mnogi zločini i misteriji koje treba riješiti, a predvodi ih poručnik Horatio Caine (David Caruso). Caine i Delko su u Brazilu. Odjel nakon Natalijinog prelaska u Policiju održava Duquesne. Čekaju ih istrage zločina, ali i rješavanje unutarnjih problema. Wolfe se slučajno upliće u krivotvorenje, a Duquesne je u istrazi bande ugrožen život….

programme.title: Magnum P.I.
programme.desc: Bivši pripadnik američkih mornaričkih specijalca vraća se iz Afganistana i koristi svoje vojne vještine kako bi postao privatni istražitelj na Havajima. Jay Hernandez glumi Thomasa Magnuma u suvremenoj adaptaciji o bivšem pripadniku američkih specijalaca koji se vraća kući iz Afganistana i koristi svoje vojne vještine kako bi postao privatni detektiv na Havajima.

programme.title: Art School Confidential
Umjetnička škola - povjerljivo
programme.desc:
Art School Confidential: Directed by Terry Zwigoff. With Max Minghella, Sophia Myles, John Malkovich, Jim Broadbent. Starting from childhood attempts at illustration, the protagonist pursues his true obsession to art school. But as he learns how the art world really works, he finds that he must adapt his vision to the reality that confronts him." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0364955/","name":"Art School Confidential","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjA2NzUzNzIwMV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMDgxNDgzMQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Starting from childhood attempts at illustration, the protagonist pursues his true obsession to art school. But as he learns how the art world really works, he finds that he must adapt his vision to the reality that confronts him.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0364955/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"mothratwin89"},"dateCreated":"2006-05-15","inLanguage":"English","name":"Great film- fun, exciting, fascinating, and keeps you pleasantly off balance","reviewBody":"First off, let me just say how much I love Max Minghella. I saw Bee Season at a film festival a while back and straight off knew he was going to do fantastic things with his career. So far he's proved me right.

I have been anticipating Art School Confidential for a long time. I found out about it through the IMDb, and as a big fan of Zwigoff's previous work, I was really looking forward to seeing what he was going to do with the fabulous cast he had assembled (Malkovich, Huston, Buscemi, etc). The movie did not disappoint.

The beginning of the film is about what I expected- cute, off-beat story about a talented geek who goes to art school and pursues the girl of his dreams. And then it got dark. And then it got very dark. And then it got extremely dark. I soon realized I had no idea where it was going to take me next, and that excited me. The 'mystery' aspect of the movie is brilliantly done as well- it keeps you just well informed enough that you have about a 50/50 chance of figuring it out preemptively, and you'll always realize what's going on just when you need to.

I have read reviews that called Art School Confidential misanthropic, among other things. I disagree. It has misanthropic aspects, misanthropic characters, but overall I found that it ended on an expressly positive note. I absolutely loved the ending. Five minutes before it ended, I wasn't sure how it was going to end, and that, in my opinion, is the best way to do it. Zwigoff's direction is also very impressive. There's a distinct difference in the atmosphere throughout- it starts out looking and feeling sunnier and lighter, and as Minghella's character becomes darker, so does the look of the movie. Just one of those little things that adds to the overall experience.

Art School Confidential thoroughly covers ground that Ghost World touched on briefly- namely, the line between art and BS. It is clearly a subject on which Terry Zwigoff has a lot to say, and he says it very eloquently. The cast is great, the music is great, the direction is great. Go see it. And let me say again... I love Max Minghella. Here's hoping he doesn't turn to stupid teen flicks to pay the bills.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":17117,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.3},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"2006-05-12","keywords":"art school,nude modeling,nude model,art model,art class","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Art School Confidential","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2981560601","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTlhMzU5ZGYtMTc4Ni00ZDU1LWFkMDYtNjA5ZmFiOTQyYzYwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTlhMzU5ZGYtMTc4Ni00ZDU1LWFkMDYtNjA5ZmFiOTQyYzYwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Sony Pictures Home Entertainment"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1540404/","name":"Max Minghella"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0617009/","name":"Sophia Myles"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000518/","name":"John Malkovich"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0959062/","name":"Terry Zwigoff"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0026841/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0014453/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0040322/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0167280/","name":"Daniel Clowes"}],"duration":"PT1H42M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Teorija velikog praska
programme.desc: Leonard (Johnny Galecki) i Sheldon (Jim Parsons) mogu vam ispričati sve što vas zanima o kvantnoj fizici, no rješavanje najjednostavnijih stvari iz svakodnevnog života potpuna im je zagonetka. Oni su bez sumnje genijalni, no zašto im je onda tako teško prići ljepšem spolu? Uz pomoć Kaley Cuoco, prijatelji će naučiti najvažniju životnu lekciju!Leonard (Johnny Galecki) i Sheldon (Jim Parsons) mogu vam ispričati sve što vas zanima o kvantnoj fizici, no rješavanje najjednostavnijih stvari iz svakodnevnog života potpuna je zagonetka dvojici prijatelja. Oni su briljantni fizičari koji mogu shvatiti kako svemir funkcionira, no kako komunicirati s ljudima, osobito djevojkama, potpuni im je misterij. To se počinje mijenjati kada se Penny (Kaley Cuoco) doseli u njihovo susjedstvo. I dok je Sheldon sretan sa svojim disfunkcionalnim prijateljima Wolowitzom (Simon Helberg) i Koothrappalijem (Kunal Nayyar), Leonard u Penny vidi šansu za romansom.

programme.title: Castle
Castle
programme.desc:
Castle: Created by Andrew W. Marlowe. With Nathan Fillion, Stana Katic, Susan Sullivan, Jon Huertas. After a serial killer imitates the plots of his novels, successful mystery novelist Richard "Rick" Castle receives permission from the Mayor of New York City to tag along with an NYPD homicide investigation team for research purposes." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt1219024/","name":"Castle","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjM2NjU0ODU0NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMDAwMzg5NjE@._V1_.jpg","description":"After a serial killer imitates the plots of his novels, successful mystery novelist Richard "Rick" Castle receives permission from the Mayor of New York City to tag along with an NYPD homicide investigation team for research purposes","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1219024/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"jamylie"},"dateCreated":"2009-03-10","inLanguage":"English","name":"Ah, a Breath of Fresh Air.","reviewBody":"The pilot episode for ABC's new crime show "Castle" left me wanting more, much more in fact, and that is exactly what a good pilot should do. The relationship formed between the two leads is unquestionably one of the best and is, so far, most endearing. It is impossible to not like them.

I'll start with Nathan Fillion(of "Firefly" fame). Nathan plays Richard 'Rick' Castle. His charm and wit and spot-on comedic delivery make him alone the reason to tune in each week. Move over David Boreanaz 'cause Nathan has got you beat in the plucky-comedic-male-sidekick-to-tough-and-serious-female-cop role. Nathan comes off as the friend we all want and treasure. Having followed Nathan's career rather closely I am glad to see him in this role. It fits his nature and you can tell he knows it too just by watching him. It's in his postures and mannerisms and facial expressions. I believe he said in an interview that he is "72%" this character and that sounds about right. He is comfortable in this role. Similar to how he was comfortable when playing Malcom Reynolds in "Firefly"(which, by the way, is the greatest show of all time...period).

Then there is Stana Katic, who plays Detective Kate Beckett, and God is she gorgeous and enticing. No wonder Nathan's character can't get enough of her. Stana manages to instill in the portrayal of her character enough grit and fortitude to be mysterious and alluring, while retaining a good amount of the audiences confidence in her ability to be a bad-ass. On the other side, though, she is beautiful and her lightly-flirtatious nature does not detract from the other part of her character but rather enriches it making her feel real rather than just a cliché tough female cop(because TV is full of them right now).

What it comes down to, ladies and gentlemen, is chemistry and these two have it. They are a joy to watch even when they are not in scenes together and that is what will keep viewers tuning in each week. This show has great promise.

Before I go I will note that it was nice to see real authors on the show(I will not reveal who). It adds another layer to Castle's character and makes for an amusing poker scene. I hope the producers arrange for more cameos of this nature.

Marlowe"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Castle: The Complete Fifth Season","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3651252761","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjQ4YmRiYmMtMWZkZi00ZDA4LTgzZWItOTgxYjExYjI5NDRhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjQ4YmRiYmMtMWZkZi00ZDA4LTgzZWItOTgxYjExYjI5NDRhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"CT 1A"}}</script><metacontent="

After a serial killer imitates the plots of his novels, successful mystery novelist Richard "Rick" Castle receives permission from the Mayor of New York City to tag along with an NYPD homicide investigation team for research purposes." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt1219024/","name":"Castle","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjM2NjU0ODU0NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMDAwMzg5NjE@._V1_.jpg","description":"After a serial killer imitates the plots of his novels, successful mystery novelist Richard "Rick" Castle receives permission from the Mayor of New York City to tag along with an NYPD homicide investigation team for research purposes","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1219024/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"jamylie","dateCreated":"2009-03-10","inLanguage":"English","name":"Ah, a Breath of Fresh Air.","reviewBody":"The pilot episode for ABC's new crime show "Castle" left me wanting more, much more in fact, and that is exactly what a good pilot should do. The relationship formed between the two leads is unquestionably one of the best and is, so far, most endearing. It is impossible to not like them.

I'll start with Nathan Fillion(of "Firefly" fame). Nathan plays Richard 'Rick' Castle. His charm and wit and spot-on comedic delivery make him alone the reason to tune in each week. Move over David Boreanaz 'cause Nathan has got you beat in the plucky-comedic-male-sidekick-to-tough-and-serious-female-cop role. Nathan comes off as the friend we all want and treasure. Having followed Nathan's career rather closely I am glad to see him in this role. It fits his nature and you can tell he knows it too just by watching him. It's in his postures and mannerisms and facial expressions. I believe he said in an interview that he is "72%" this character and that sounds about right. He is comfortable in this role. Similar to how he was comfortable when playing Malcom Reynolds in "Firefly"(which, by the way, is the greatest show of all time...period).

Then there is Stana Katic, who plays Detective Kate Beckett, and God is she gorgeous and enticing. No wonder Nathan's character can't get enough of her. Stana manages to instill in the portrayal of her character enough grit and fortitude to be mysterious and alluring, while retaining a good amount of the audiences confidence in her ability to be a bad-ass. On the other side, though, she is beautiful and her lightly-flirtatious nature does not detract from the other part of her character but rather enriches it making her feel real rather than just a cliché tough female cop(because TV is full of them right now).

What it comes down to, ladies and gentlemen, is chemistry and these two have it. They are a joy to watch even when they are not in scenes together and that is what will keep viewers tuning in each week. This show has great promise.

Before I go I will note that it was nice to see real authors on the show(I will not reveal who). It adds another layer to Castle's character and makes for an amusing poker scene. I hope the producers arrange for more cameos of this nature.

The relationship formed between the two leads is unquestionably one of the best and is, so far, most endearing. It is impossible to not like them.

I'll start with Nathan Fillion(of "Firefly" fame). Nathan plays Richard 'Rick' Castle. His charm and wit and spot-on comedic delivery make him alone the reason to tune in each week. Move over David Boreanaz 'cause Nathan has got you beat in the plucky-comedic-male-sidekick-to-tough-and-serious-female-cop role. Nathan comes off as the friend we all want and treasure. Having followed Nathan's career rather closely I am glad to see him in this role. It fits his nature and you can tell he knows it too just by watching him. It's in his postures and mannerisms and facial expressions. I believe he said in an interview that he is "72%" this character and that sounds about right. He is comfortable in this role. programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: Kako bi se razriješili brojni zločini, tu je ekipa za očevid CSI: Miami. Pred njima se nalaze mnogi zločini i misteriji koje treba riješiti, a predvodi ih poručnik Horatio Caine (David Caruso). Caine i Delko su u Brazilu. Odjel nakon Natalijinog prelaska u Policiju održava Duquesne. Čekaju ih istrage zločina, ali i rješavanje unutarnjih problema. Wolfe se slučajno upliće u krivotvorenje, a Duquesne je u istrazi bande ugrožen život….

programme.title: Magnum P.I.
programme.desc: Bivši pripadnik američkih mornaričkih specijalca vraća se iz Afganistana i koristi svoje vojne vještine kako bi postao privatni istražitelj na Havajima. Jay Hernandez glumi Thomasa Magnuma u suvremenoj adaptaciji o bivšem pripadniku američkih specijalaca koji se vraća kući iz Afganistana i koristi svoje vojne vještine kako bi postao privatni detektiv na Havajima.

credits.actor: Jackie Chan, Amber Valletta, Madeline Carroll, Will Shadley, Billy Ray Cyrus, Magnús Scheving, George Lopez, Lucas Till

programme.title: Teorija velikog praska
programme.desc: Leonard (Johnny Galecki) i Sheldon (Jim Parsons) mogu vam ispričati sve što vas zanima o kvantnoj fizici, no rješavanje najjednostavnijih stvari iz svakodnevnog života potpuna im je zagonetka. Oni su bez sumnje genijalni, no zašto im je onda tako teško prići ljepšem spolu? Uz pomoć Kaley Cuoco, prijatelji će naučiti najvažniju životnu lekciju!Leonard (Johnny Galecki) i Sheldon (Jim Parsons) mogu vam ispričati sve što vas zanima o kvantnoj fizici, no rješavanje najjednostavnijih stvari iz svakodnevnog života potpuna je zagonetka dvojici prijatelja. Oni su briljantni fizičari koji mogu shvatiti kako svemir funkcionira, no kako komunicirati s ljudima, osobito djevojkama, potpuni im je misterij. To se počinje mijenjati kada se Penny (Kaley Cuoco) doseli u njihovo susjedstvo. I dok je Sheldon sretan sa svojim disfunkcionalnim prijateljima Wolowitzom (Simon Helberg) i Koothrappalijem (Kunal Nayyar), Leonard u Penny vidi šansu za romansom.

programme.title: Teorija velikog praska
programme.desc: Deseta sezona staroj ekipi donosi u život nove ljude poput djeteta Howarda i Bernadette, ali ljubavni problemi svih genijalaca su i dalje prisutni. U 8. sezoni serije, Leonard (Johnny Galecki) i Penny (Kaley Cuoco) odlučili su okruniti svoju vezu brakom nakon nekoliko nespretnih prekida u prošlosti. Čak je i Sheldon (Jim Parsons) pronašao družicu te je sklopio "ugovor o vezi" s neurobiologinjom Amy Farrah Fowler (Mayim Bialik), koja ipak traži pauzu jer joj smeta spori napredak njihove veze. Dok Bernadette (Melissa Rauch) pomaže Howardu (Simon Helberg) da se pomiri sa smrću njegove majke, sramežljivi Raj (Kunal Nayyar) nastavlja svoju dosad najdugovječniju vezu s Emily (Laura Spencer).

credits.actor: Jodie Comer, Sandra Oh, Darren Boyd, Kirby Howell-Baptiste, Sean Delaney, Ken Nwosu, Fiona Shaw, Owen McDonnell

programme.title: Chicago Fire
Chicago u plamenu
programme.desc:
Chicago Fire: Created by Michael Brandt, Derek Haas. With Taylor Kinney, Christian Stolte, Eamonn Walker, Joe Minoso. The story of firefighters and paramedics in the city of Chicago, both on a personal and professional level." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt2261391/","name":"Chicago Fire","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjEyMWY5ZjMtNGQ5Mi00YTMxLWIwMjYtNDAyZmQ3YmI3ZTg4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyODUxOTU0OTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"The story of firefighters and paramedics in the city of Chicago, both on a personal and professional level.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2261391/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"crittiebee"},"dateCreated":"2014-05-20","inLanguage":"English","name":"A Great Edition to TV Entertainment....Chicago Fire","reviewBody":"When this show first aired, I was not interested on watching a fire fighting drama. Besides, I've been watching another Wolf Production since 1999 and that was good enough for me. However, when Chicago PD was introduced, I decided to watch it because it came on directly after my favorite show and I love TV drama series. I feel in love with Chicago PD because of the zest and criminal kick-ass and I was hooked.

When Chicago Fire crossed over with Chicago PD recently, I was forced to watch Chicago Fire. Hummm, Chicago Fire very interesting and exciting I thought. I went to HBO On Demand and watched Season 2 of Chicago Fire. Let me tell you, I didn't cook, I didn't answer my phone, I ordered food delivery service and didn't move off of my sofa(only for bbreak) until I watched every episode. I then went to a local retail store and bought Season 1 and the disconnect from the world started all over again. By now you know where my review is going.

Watching Chicago Fire help me to understand Detective Voight, Dawson etc.. and how Chicago PD was piloted. I was upset with me for not watching Chicago Fire initially. Readers, to understand Chicago PD, you have to watch Chicago Fire. I love the intertwining of the shows. It is so damn interesting.

Chicago Fire is a potpourri of diversity, family, loyalty, emotions and laughter. A show that promotes life/death,the response and the danger firefighters face everyday, gives me a deeper respect for my local firefighter and EMT services.

I commend Mr. Wolf for having such great writers and actors/actress, I am humbled. I am aware it's only entertainment. However it's entertainment in a true and realistic form.

One of the Best Shows on TV.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":50700,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8},"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Action","Drama"],"datePublished":"2012-10-10","keywords":"fire department,firefighter,rescue,rescue team,coworker relationship","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1978325/","name":"Taylor Kinney"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0831601/","name":"Christian Stolte"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0907708/","name":"Eamonn Walker"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0019598/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0046592/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0104973/","name":"Michael Brandt"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0351929/","name":"Derek Haas"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Season 4 First Look","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1918481177","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjM0NzAxNDQxMl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMzcwMzEwNzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjM0NzAxNDQxMl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMzcwMzEwNzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Get a first look at Season 4 of "Chicago Fire.""}}</script><metacontent="

programme.desc: Robin je sigurna da ona i Barney mogu ponovno biti par, a Ted preuzima ulogu Marvinove dadilje. Robin je odlučna ponovno osvojiti Barneyja bez obzira na sve. U međuvremenu, Ted uskače kao Marvinova dadilja, a Marshall i Lily shvaćaju da Ted koristi Marvina kako bi zamijenio svoje drugo dijete: zgradu GNB-a.

programme.title: Cars
Auti
programme.desc: Cars: Directed by John Lasseter, Joe Ranft. With Owen Wilson, Paul Newman, Bonnie Hunt, Larry the Cable Guy. A hot-shot race-car named Lightning McQueen gets waylaid in Radiator Springs, where he finds the true meaning of friendship and family." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0317219/","name":"Cars","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTg5NzY0MzA2MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTYwNDc3NTc2._V1_.jpg","description":"A hot-shot race-car named Lightning McQueen gets waylaid in Radiator Springs, where he finds the true meaning of friendship and family.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0317219/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"ahuffman_2000"},"dateCreated":"2006-05-27","inLanguage":"English","name":"Pixar and Disney did it again!","reviewBody":"Without giving away any of the story, here's my take. I attended the premiere of CARS at LMS on Friday, May 26. True to Disney form, the premiere itself was spectacular. Four giant screens, live entertainment,lots of fireworks, great inclusion of military personnel, and as good of a red carpet as you can do with chain link fenced areas... This movie rates right in the middle of Pixar releases for me. I place it above Monsters Inc, A Bug's Life and Toy Story 2, but not as good as the "original", the best ever, Toy Story, and The Incredibles. Everything just looks so real in this movie. The dust stirred up when Lightning drives off, the scenery around Route 66 (well, maybe not those mountains that look like the fins of old cars). Even the shine on the clean cars looks so real. As an adult, I enjoyed the story line. I can't tell you how the kids would like it, as by the time the movie finally started, my kids were asleep. As always, don't leave your seat until all of the credits roll. Sometimes they are some of the funniest clips in the movie! You'll love them this time, as they tie back to prior Pixar movies, in a car sort of way. This is definitely a movie we'll add to the DVD collection. I really hope this movie does well since it's the first release since Disney bought Pixar. Don't go in looking for the action or adult humor of The Incredibles. If you do you'll be disappointed. Just go in looking for the "Disney always has a good moral behind its animated movies" type of movie and you will really enjoy it. Paul Newman and Larry the Cable Guy really have the best characters in the movie. And while John Ratzenberger's character doesn't have a lot of screen time, I really enjoyed him! I'll be going back to see it when it releases in theaters so I can get a better feel for the sound, as it wasn't the best in an outdoor setting. In my opinion, it easily beats the other animated movies released over the past year or so.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":393517,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.1},"contentRating":"G","genre":["Animation","Adventure","Comedy"],"datePublished":"2006-09-06","keywords":"car,car movie,route 66,truck,tow truck","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"How the Best Racing Films Raise the Stakes","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi365149977","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjgwYTRjOTMtZWIwMy00Nzc2LWJiMDMtMDFkMjRhYTYwY2VmXkEyXkFqcGdeQWFsZWxvZw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjgwYTRjOTMtZWIwMy00Nzc2LWJiMDMtMDFkMjRhYTYwY2VmXkEyXkFqcGdeQWFsZWxvZw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"On this IMDbrief, sponsored by Coca-Cola, we're putting the pedal to the metal on the best racing films of all time."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005562/","name":"Owen Wilson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001372/","name":"Bonnie Hunt"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000056/","name":"Paul Newman"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005124/","name":"John Lasseter"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0710020/","name":"Joe Ranft"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0017902/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0008970/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005124/","name":"John Lasseter"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0710020/","name":"Joe Ranft"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0460146/","name":"Jorgen Klubien"}],"duration":"PT1H57M"}</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 2261391, Title: Chicago Fire, --- Description: Chicago Fire: Created by Michael Brandt, Derek Haas. With Taylor Kinney, Christian Stolte, Eamonn Walker, Joe Minoso. The story of firefighters and paramedics in the city of Chicago, both on a personal and professional level." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt2261391/","name":"Chicago Fire","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjEyMWY5ZjMtNGQ5Mi00YTMxLWIwMjYtNDAyZmQ3YmI3ZTg4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyODUxOTU0OTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"The story of firefighters and paramedics in the city of Chicago, both on a personal and professional level.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2261391/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"crittiebee","dateCreated":"2014-05-20","inLanguage":"English","name":"A Great Edition to TV Entertainment....Chicago Fire","reviewBody":"When this show first aired, I was not interested on watching a fire fighting drama. Besides, I've been watching another Wolf Production since 1999 and that was good enough for me. However, when Chicago PD was introduced, I decided to watch it because it came on directly after my favorite show and I love TV drama series. I feel in love with Chicago PD because of the zest and criminal kick-ass and I was hooked.

When Chicago Fire crossed over with Chicago PD recently, I was forced to watch Chicago Fire. Hummm, Chicago Fire very interesting and exciting I thought. I went to HBO On Demand and watched Season 2 of Chicago Fire. Let me tell you, I didn't cook, I didn't answer my phone, I ordered food delivery service and didn't move off of my sofa(only for bbreak) until I watched every episode. I then went to a local retail store and bought Season 1 and the disconnect from the world started all over again. By now you know where my review is going.

Watching Chicago Fire help me to understand Detective Voight, Dawson etc.. and how Chicago PD was piloted. I was upset with me for not watching Chicago Fire initially. Readers, to understand Chicago PD, you have to watch Chicago Fire. I love the intertwining of the shows. It is so damn interesting.

Chicago Fire is a potpourri of diversity, family, loyalty, emotions and laughter. A show that promotes life/death,the response and the danger firefighters face everyday, gives me a deeper respect for my local firefighter and EMT services.

I commend Mr. Wolf for having such great writers and actors/actress, I am humbled. I am aware it's only entertainment. However it's entertainment in a true and realistic form.

One of the Best Shows on TV.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":50700,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8,"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Action","Drama"],"datePublished":"2012-10-10","keywords":"fire department,firefighter,rescue,rescue team,coworker relationship","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1978325/","name":"Taylor Kinney","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0831601/","name":"Christian Stolte","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0907708/","name":"Eamonn Walker"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0019598/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0046592/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0104973/","name":"Michael Brandt","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0351929/","name":"Derek Haas"],"trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Season 4 First Look","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1918481177","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjM0NzAxNDQxMl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMzcwMzEwNzE@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjM0NzAxNDQxMl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMzcwMzEwNzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Get a first look at Season 4 of "Chicago Fire.""</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Tangled
Vrlo zapetljana priča
programme.desc:
Tangled: Directed by Nathan Greno, Byron Howard. With Mandy Moore, Zachary Levi, Donna Murphy, Ron Perlman. The magically long-haired Rapunzel has spent her entire life in a tower, but now that a runaway thief has stumbled upon her, she is about to discover the world for the first time, and who she really is." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0398286/","name":"Tangled","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTAxNDYxMjg0MjNeQTJeQWpwZ15BbWU3MDcyNTk2OTM@._V1_.jpg","description":"The magically long-haired Rapunzel has spent her entire life in a tower, but now that a runaway thief has stumbled upon her, she is about to discover the world for the first time, and who she really is.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0398286/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"maestro-20"},"dateCreated":"2010-11-25","inLanguage":"English","name":"Disney's back with their fairytale","reviewBody":"I was apprehensive, to say the least, when I went to see Tangled, after the disappointment that was Princess and the Frog. First, Disney's back with CGI animation, which hasn't really worked that great except, maybe to some extent, Bolt. Second, the trailers made it look really slapstick -- I'm rather wary of today's animation features that try too hard to be hip and fast-paced and silly.

I was pleasantly surprised. Sure, there were slapstick and broad humor sure to make little kiddos laugh. But I was surprised by the sophistication as well. The screwball comedy between the hero and heroine is very well done; adults can appreciate that. The sidekicks, in particular the Max and Pascal, are hilarious. The hero and heroine are very likable and not flat. And there's a sense of sadness/wistfulness throughout the whole show that the adults will understand.

But what really is great is the animation. This is Pixar-worthy great. In fact, after a while I forgot it was CGI (which tends to be a bit stiff and crude when it comes to character animation). The human characters have that hand-drawn quality even though they're CG. In fact, they're more expressive than the hand-drawn characters in Princess and the Frog. The backgrounds are gorgeous (I can count every blade of grass). And there's an iconic scene where the kingdom rouses from darkness to light with thousands of floating lanterns -- it really is magical. It reminds me of classics such as Beauty and the Beast and Sleeping Beauty.

Best of all, the movie is not just all laughs and slapstick. It has heart too. Even the minor characters such as the King and Queen -- you can feel the emotions. And the romance is believable and not cheesy.

Like I said, I was very pleasantly surprised. It's something that is worthy of Pixar, and I'm glad to see Disney back on their game. While Princess and the Frog was a missed opportunity, Tangled is almost perfect.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":428452,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.7},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Animation","Adventure","Comedy"],"datePublished":"2010-12-01","keywords":"rapunzel,based on fairy tale,disney,flower,female protagonist","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Tangled: Trailer #2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi385091865","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTkxMzI2NDA5MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNTE1OTYzMzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTkxMzI2NDA5MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNTE1OTYzMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"The long-haired Princess Rapunzel has spent her entire life in a tower, but when she falls in love with a bandit who was passing by she must venture into the outside world for the first time to find him."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0601553/","name":"Mandy Moore"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1157048/","name":"Zachary Levi"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0614220/","name":"Donna Murphy"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1977355/","name":"Nathan Greno"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0397174/","name":"Byron Howard"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0074039/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0008970/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1557594/","name":"Dan Fogelman"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0342278/","name":"Jacob Grimm"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0342303/","name":"Wilhelm Grimm"}],"duration":"PT1H40M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Chicago Fire
Chicago u plamenu
programme.desc:
Chicago Fire: Created by Michael Brandt, Derek Haas. With Taylor Kinney, Christian Stolte, Eamonn Walker, Joe Minoso. The story of firefighters and paramedics in the city of Chicago, both on a personal and professional level." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt2261391/","name":"Chicago Fire","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjEyMWY5ZjMtNGQ5Mi00YTMxLWIwMjYtNDAyZmQ3YmI3ZTg4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyODUxOTU0OTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"The story of firefighters and paramedics in the city of Chicago, both on a personal and professional level.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2261391/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"crittiebee"},"dateCreated":"2014-05-20","inLanguage":"English","name":"A Great Edition to TV Entertainment....Chicago Fire","reviewBody":"When this show first aired, I was not interested on watching a fire fighting drama. Besides, I've been watching another Wolf Production since 1999 and that was good enough for me. However, when Chicago PD was introduced, I decided to watch it because it came on directly after my favorite show and I love TV drama series. I feel in love with Chicago PD because of the zest and criminal kick-ass and I was hooked.

When Chicago Fire crossed over with Chicago PD recently, I was forced to watch Chicago Fire. Hummm, Chicago Fire very interesting and exciting I thought. I went to HBO On Demand and watched Season 2 of Chicago Fire. Let me tell you, I didn't cook, I didn't answer my phone, I ordered food delivery service and didn't move off of my sofa(only for bbreak) until I watched every episode. I then went to a local retail store and bought Season 1 and the disconnect from the world started all over again. By now you know where my review is going.

Watching Chicago Fire help me to understand Detective Voight, Dawson etc.. and how Chicago PD was piloted. I was upset with me for not watching Chicago Fire initially. Readers, to understand Chicago PD, you have to watch Chicago Fire. I love the intertwining of the shows. It is so damn interesting.

Chicago Fire is a potpourri of diversity, family, loyalty, emotions and laughter. A show that promotes life/death,the response and the danger firefighters face everyday, gives me a deeper respect for my local firefighter and EMT services.

I commend Mr. Wolf for having such great writers and actors/actress, I am humbled. I am aware it's only entertainment. However it's entertainment in a true and realistic form.

One of the Best Shows on TV.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":50700,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8},"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Action","Drama"],"datePublished":"2012-10-10","keywords":"fire department,firefighter,rescue,rescue team,coworker relationship","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1978325/","name":"Taylor Kinney"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0831601/","name":"Christian Stolte"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0907708/","name":"Eamonn Walker"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0019598/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0046592/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0104973/","name":"Michael Brandt"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0351929/","name":"Derek Haas"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Season 4 First Look","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1918481177","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjM0NzAxNDQxMl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMzcwMzEwNzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjM0NzAxNDQxMl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMzcwMzEwNzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Get a first look at Season 4 of "Chicago Fire.""}}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Chicago Fire
Chicago u plamenu
programme.desc:
Chicago Fire: Created by Michael Brandt, Derek Haas. With Taylor Kinney, Christian Stolte, Eamonn Walker, Joe Minoso. The story of firefighters and paramedics in the city of Chicago, both on a personal and professional level." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt2261391/","name":"Chicago Fire","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjEyMWY5ZjMtNGQ5Mi00YTMxLWIwMjYtNDAyZmQ3YmI3ZTg4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyODUxOTU0OTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"The story of firefighters and paramedics in the city of Chicago, both on a personal and professional level.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2261391/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"crittiebee"},"dateCreated":"2014-05-20","inLanguage":"English","name":"A Great Edition to TV Entertainment....Chicago Fire","reviewBody":"When this show first aired, I was not interested on watching a fire fighting drama. Besides, I've been watching another Wolf Production since 1999 and that was good enough for me. However, when Chicago PD was introduced, I decided to watch it because it came on directly after my favorite show and I love TV drama series. I feel in love with Chicago PD because of the zest and criminal kick-ass and I was hooked.

When Chicago Fire crossed over with Chicago PD recently, I was forced to watch Chicago Fire. Hummm, Chicago Fire very interesting and exciting I thought. I went to HBO On Demand and watched Season 2 of Chicago Fire. Let me tell you, I didn't cook, I didn't answer my phone, I ordered food delivery service and didn't move off of my sofa(only for bbreak) until I watched every episode. I then went to a local retail store and bought Season 1 and the disconnect from the world started all over again. By now you know where my review is going.

Watching Chicago Fire help me to understand Detective Voight, Dawson etc.. and how Chicago PD was piloted. I was upset with me for not watching Chicago Fire initially. Readers, to understand Chicago PD, you have to watch Chicago Fire. I love the intertwining of the shows. It is so damn interesting.

Chicago Fire is a potpourri of diversity, family, loyalty, emotions and laughter. A show that promotes life/death,the response and the danger firefighters face everyday, gives me a deeper respect for my local firefighter and EMT services.

I commend Mr. Wolf for having such great writers and actors/actress, I am humbled. I am aware it's only entertainment. However it's entertainment in a true and realistic form.

One of the Best Shows on TV.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":50700,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8},"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Action","Drama"],"datePublished":"2012-10-10","keywords":"fire department,firefighter,rescue,rescue team,coworker relationship","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1978325/","name":"Taylor Kinney"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0831601/","name":"Christian Stolte"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0907708/","name":"Eamonn Walker"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0019598/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0046592/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0104973/","name":"Michael Brandt"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0351929/","name":"Derek Haas"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Season 4 First Look","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1918481177","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjM0NzAxNDQxMl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMzcwMzEwNzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjM0NzAxNDQxMl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMzcwMzEwNzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Get a first look at Season 4 of "Chicago Fire.""}}</script><metacontent="

However, when Chicago PD was introduced, I decided to watch it because it came on directly after my favorite show and I love TV drama series. I feel in love with Chicago PD because of the zest and criminal kick-ass and I was hooked.

When Chicago Fire crossed over with Chicago PD recently, I was forced to watch Chicago Fire. Hummm, Chicago Fire very interesting and exciting I thought. I went to HBO On Demand and watched Season 2 of Chicago Fire. Let me tell you, I didn't cook, I didn't answer my phone, I ordered food delivery service and didn't move off of my sofa(only for bbreak) until I watched every episode. I then went to a local retail store and bought Season 1 and the disconnect from the world started all over again. By now you know where my review is going.

Watching Chicago Fire help me to understand Detective Voight, Dawson etc.. and how Chicago PD was piloted. I was upset with me for not watching Chicago Fire initially. programme.title: Tangled
Vrlo zapetljana priča
programme.desc:
Tangled: Directed by Nathan Greno, Byron Howard. With Mandy Moore, Zachary Levi, Donna Murphy, Ron Perlman. The magically long-haired Rapunzel has spent her entire life in a tower, but now that a runaway thief has stumbled upon her, she is about to discover the world for the first time, and who she really is." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0398286/","name":"Tangled","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTAxNDYxMjg0MjNeQTJeQWpwZ15BbWU3MDcyNTk2OTM@._V1_.jpg","description":"The magically long-haired Rapunzel has spent her entire life in a tower, but now that a runaway thief has stumbled upon her, she is about to discover the world for the first time, and who she really is.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0398286/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"maestro-20"},"dateCreated":"2010-11-25","inLanguage":"English","name":"Disney's back with their fairytale","reviewBody":"I was apprehensive, to say the least, when I went to see Tangled, after the disappointment that was Princess and the Frog. First, Disney's back with CGI animation, which hasn't really worked that great except, maybe to some extent, Bolt. Second, the trailers made it look really slapstick -- I'm rather wary of today's animation features that try too hard to be hip and fast-paced and silly.

I was pleasantly surprised. Sure, there were slapstick and broad humor sure to make little kiddos laugh. But I was surprised by the sophistication as well. The screwball comedy between the hero and heroine is very well done; adults can appreciate that. The sidekicks, in particular the Max and Pascal, are hilarious. The hero and heroine are very likable and not flat. And there's a sense of sadness/wistfulness throughout the whole show that the adults will understand.

But what really is great is the animation. This is Pixar-worthy great. In fact, after a while I forgot it was CGI (which tends to be a bit stiff and crude when it comes to character animation). The human characters have that hand-drawn quality even though they're CG. In fact, they're more expressive than the hand-drawn characters in Princess and the Frog. The backgrounds are gorgeous (I can count every blade of grass). And there's an iconic scene where the kingdom rouses from darkness to light with thousands of floating lanterns -- it really is magical. It reminds me of classics such as Beauty and the Beast and Sleeping Beauty.

Best of all, the movie is not just all laughs and slapstick. It has heart too. Even the minor characters such as the King and Queen -- you can feel the emotions. And the romance is believable and not cheesy.

Like I said, I was very pleasantly surprised. It's something that is worthy of Pixar, and I'm glad to see Disney back on their game. While Princess and the Frog was a missed opportunity, Tangled is almost perfect.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":428452,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.7},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Animation","Adventure","Comedy"],"datePublished":"2010-12-01","keywords":"rapunzel,based on fairy tale,disney,flower,female protagonist","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Tangled: Trailer #2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi385091865","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTkxMzI2NDA5MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNTE1OTYzMzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTkxMzI2NDA5MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNTE1OTYzMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"The long-haired Princess Rapunzel has spent her entire life in a tower, but when she falls in love with a bandit who was passing by she must venture into the outside world for the first time to find him."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0601553/","name":"Mandy Moore"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1157048/","name":"Zachary Levi"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0614220/","name":"Donna Murphy"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1977355/","name":"Nathan Greno"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0397174/","name":"Byron Howard"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0074039/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0008970/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1557594/","name":"Dan Fogelman"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0342278/","name":"Jacob Grimm"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0342303/","name":"Wilhelm Grimm"}],"duration":"PT1H40M"}</script><metacontent="

First, Disney's back with CGI animation, which hasn't really worked that great except, maybe to some extent, Bolt. The screwball comedy between the hero and heroine is very well done; adults can appreciate that. The sidekicks, in particular the Max and Pascal, are hilarious. The hero and heroine are very likable and not flat. And there's a sense of sadness/wistfulness throughout the whole show that the adults will understand.

But what really is great is the animation. This is Pixar-worthy great. In fact, after a while I forgot it was CGI (which tends to be a bit stiff and crude when it comes to character animation). The human characters have that hand-drawn quality even though they're CG. In fact, they're more expressive than the hand-drawn characters in Princess and the Frog. The backgrounds are gorgeous (I can count every blade of grass). And there's an iconic scene where the kingdom rouses from darkness to light with thousands of floating lanterns -- it really is magical. It reminds me of classics such as Beauty and the Beast and Sleeping Beauty.

Best of all, the movie is not just all laughs and slapstick. It has heart too. Even the minor characters such as the King and Queen -- you can feel the emotions. And the romance is believable and not cheesy.

Like I said, I was very pleasantly surprised. It's something that is worthy of Pixar, and I'm glad to see Disney back on their game. While Princess and the Frog was a missed opportunity, Tangled is almost perfect.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":428452,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.7,"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Animation","Adventure","Comedy"],"datePublished":"2010-12-01","keywords":"rapunzel,based on fairy tale,disney,flower,female protagonist","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Tangled: Trailer #2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi385091865","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTkxMzI2NDA5MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNTE1OTYzMzE@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTkxMzI2NDA5MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNTE1OTYzMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"The long-haired Princess Rapunzel has spent her entire life in a tower, but when she falls in love with a bandit who was passing by she must venture into the outside world for the first time to find him.","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0601553/","name":"Mandy Moore","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1157048/","name":"Zachary Levi","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0614220/","name":"Donna Murphy"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1977355/","name":"Nathan Greno","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0397174/","name":"Byron Howard"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0074039/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0008970/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1557594/","name":"Dan Fogelman","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0342278/","name":"Jacob Grimm","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0342303/","name":"Wilhelm Grimm"],"duration":"PT1H40M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Chicago Fire
Chicago u plamenu
programme.desc:
Chicago Fire: Created by Michael Brandt, Derek Haas. With Taylor Kinney, Christian Stolte, Eamonn Walker, Joe Minoso. The story of firefighters and paramedics in the city of Chicago, both on a personal and professional level." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt2261391/","name":"Chicago Fire","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjEyMWY5ZjMtNGQ5Mi00YTMxLWIwMjYtNDAyZmQ3YmI3ZTg4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyODUxOTU0OTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"The story of firefighters and paramedics in the city of Chicago, both on a personal and professional level.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2261391/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"crittiebee"},"dateCreated":"2014-05-20","inLanguage":"English","name":"A Great Edition to TV Entertainment....Chicago Fire","reviewBody":"When this show first aired, I was not interested on watching a fire fighting drama. Besides, I've been watching another Wolf Production since 1999 and that was good enough for me. However, when Chicago PD was introduced, I decided to watch it because it came on directly after my favorite show and I love TV drama series. I feel in love with Chicago PD because of the zest and criminal kick-ass and I was hooked.

When Chicago Fire crossed over with Chicago PD recently, I was forced to watch Chicago Fire. Hummm, Chicago Fire very interesting and exciting I thought. I went to HBO On Demand and watched Season 2 of Chicago Fire. Let me tell you, I didn't cook, I didn't answer my phone, I ordered food delivery service and didn't move off of my sofa(only for bbreak) until I watched every episode. I then went to a local retail store and bought Season 1 and the disconnect from the world started all over again. By now you know where my review is going.

Watching Chicago Fire help me to understand Detective Voight, Dawson etc.. and how Chicago PD was piloted. I was upset with me for not watching Chicago Fire initially. Readers, to understand Chicago PD, you have to watch Chicago Fire. I love the intertwining of the shows. It is so damn interesting.

Chicago Fire is a potpourri of diversity, family, loyalty, emotions and laughter. A show that promotes life/death,the response and the danger firefighters face everyday, gives me a deeper respect for my local firefighter and EMT services.

I commend Mr. Wolf for having such great writers and actors/actress, I am humbled. I am aware it's only entertainment. However it's entertainment in a true and realistic form.

One of the Best Shows on TV.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":50700,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8},"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Action","Drama"],"datePublished":"2012-10-10","keywords":"fire department,firefighter,rescue,rescue team,coworker relationship","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1978325/","name":"Taylor Kinney"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0831601/","name":"Christian Stolte"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0907708/","name":"Eamonn Walker"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0019598/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0046592/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0104973/","name":"Michael Brandt"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0351929/","name":"Derek Haas"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Season 4 First Look","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1918481177","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjM0NzAxNDQxMl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMzcwMzEwNzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjM0NzAxNDQxMl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMzcwMzEwNzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Get a first look at Season 4 of "Chicago Fire.""}}</script><metacontent="

I feel in love with Chicago PD because of the zest and criminal kick-ass and I was hooked.

When Chicago Fire crossed over with Chicago PD recently, I was forced to watch Chicago Fire. Hummm, Chicago Fire very interesting and exciting I thought. Let me tell you, I didn't cook, I didn't answer my phone, I ordered food delivery service and didn't move off of my sofa(only for bbreak) until I watched every episode. Chicago Fire is a potpourri of diversity, family, loyalty, emotions and laughter. A show that promotes life/death,the response and the danger firefighters face everyday, gives me a deeper respect for my local firefighter and EMT services.

I commend Mr. Wolf for having such great writers and actors/actress, I am humbled. I am aware it's only entertainment. However it's entertainment in a true and realistic form.

I feel in love with Chicago PD because of the zest and criminal kick-ass and I was hooked.

When Chicago Fire crossed over with Chicago PD recently, I was forced to watch Chicago Fire. Hummm, Chicago Fire very interesting and exciting I thought. I went to HBO On Demand and watched Season 2 of Chicago Fire. Let me tell you, I didn't cook, I didn't answer my phone, I ordered food delivery service and didn't move off of my sofa(only for bbreak) until I watched every episode. I then went to a local retail store and bought Season 1 and the disconnect from the world started all over again. By now you know where my review is going.

Watching Chicago Fire help me to understand Detective Voight, Dawson etc.. and how Chicago PD was piloted. I was upset with me for not watching Chicago Fire initially. Readers, to understand Chicago PD, you have to watch Chicago Fire. I love the intertwining of the shows. It is so damn interesting.

Chicago Fire is a potpourri of diversity, family, loyalty, emotions and laughter. A show that promotes life/death,the response and the danger firefighters face everyday, gives me a deeper respect for my local firefighter and EMT services.

I commend Mr. Wolf for having such great writers and actors/actress, I am humbled. I am aware it's only entertainment. However it's entertainment in a true and realistic form.

One of the Best Shows on TV.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":50700,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8,"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Action","Drama"],"datePublished":"2012-10-10","keywords":"fire department,firefighter,rescue,rescue team,coworker relationship","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1978325/","name":"Taylor Kinney","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0831601/","name":"Christian Stolte","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0907708/","name":"Eamonn Walker"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0019598/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0046592/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0104973/","name":"Michael Brandt","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0351929/","name":"Derek Haas"],"trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Season 4 First Look","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1918481177","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjM0NzAxNDQxMl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMzcwMzEwNzE@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjM0NzAxNDQxMl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMzcwMzEwNzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Get a first look at Season 4 of "Chicago Fire.""</script><metacontent="

programme.title: National Lampoon's Vacation
Godišnji odmor snova
programme.desc:
National Lampoon's Vacation: Directed by Harold Ramis. With Chevy Chase, Beverly D'Angelo, Imogene Coca, Randy Quaid. The Griswold family's cross-country drive to the Walley World theme park proves to be much more arduous than they ever anticipated." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0085995/","name":"National Lampoon's Vacation","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmViMGQ4ZDktNzI3OC00YjVkLWJmZDgtOTI4N2FhNjhjNDVjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTUyMzE4Mzg@._V1_.jpg","description":"The Griswold family's cross-country drive to the Walley World theme park proves to be much more arduous than they ever anticipated.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0085995/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Lechuguilla"},"dateCreated":"2011-02-06","inLanguage":"English","name":""I'm On A Pilgrimage To See A Moose"","reviewBody":""Getting there is half the fun", says bland family man Clark, head of the bland suburban family, the Griswolds. He's rationalizing why the family will drive from Illinois, instead of fly, to Wally World, a moose-centered family amusement park in California. What makes this film enjoyable is that the Griswolds are so typical of banal American suburban family values.

Clark (Chevy Chase) is a good-natured sap, gullibly idealistic, and conforming. His meek wife (well played by Beverly D'Angelo) looks up to Clark. Their two teenage kids are dull blockheads, patterned after their dull parents. The boy wears ugly dental braces.

Their mode of travel is a prehistoric, humorously ugly, putrid green station wagon with cheesy brown panels. The Griswolds blast off with unlimited optimism and good-natured anticipation of the fun they will have at Wally World. But the optimism gradually fades and is replaced by grim determination after a series of on-the-road disasters that make a mockery of idealism.

The film's humor lies in its absurd plot situations, and in the dialogue. At a cookout, a down-on-his-luck Cousin Eddie (Randy Quaid) treats the Griswolds to backyard burgers, then remarks to Clark: "I don't know why they call this stuff hamburger helper. It does just fine by itself".

Casting is appropriate. Overall acting trends humorously exaggerated, consistent with the satire. Performances by Imogene Coca and John Candy add to the comedy. The bouncy song "Holiday Road" opens the film with a series of vintage American postcards in tandem with the opening credits.

My only reservation is that some of the plot contrivances are a bit over-the-top. The writers seem to be trying a little too hard.

"Vacation" is a satire on the banality of the traditional American summer ritual, and therefore thematically rich. Production values are fine. Though not perfect, this film is worth watching.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":104510,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.4},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Adventure","Comedy"],"datePublished":"1983-07-29","keywords":"road movie,dysfunctional family,national lampoon series,blonde in ferrari,lust","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2924395289","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmUxYTc1ZDMtZDM2Yi00YjdhLTg5YTctMDVlZmU2ZjRiM2QxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmUxYTc1ZDMtZDM2Yi00YjdhLTg5YTctMDVlZmU2ZjRiM2QxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000331/","name":"Chevy Chase"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000350/","name":"Beverly D'Angelo"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0168042/","name":"Imogene Coca"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000601/","name":"Harold Ramis"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0102282/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0002663/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000455/","name":"John Hughes"}],"duration":"PT1H38M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Men in Black
Ljudi u crnom
programme.desc:
Men in Black: Directed by Barry Sonnenfeld. With Tommy Lee Jones, Will Smith, Linda Fiorentino, Vincent D'Onofrio. A police officer joins a secret organization that polices and monitors extraterrestrial interactions on Earth." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0119654/","name":"Men in Black","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTlhYTVkMDktYzIyNC00NzlkLTlmN2ItOGEyMWQ4OTA2NDdmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTAyODkwOQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A police officer joins a secret organization that polices and monitors extraterrestrial interactions on Earth.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0119654/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"mOVIemAN56"},"dateCreated":"2005-05-15","inLanguage":"English","name":"Funny Sci-Fi. As Good As Ghostbusters.","reviewBody":"As I stated above, Men In Black is just as good as the sci-fi comedies Ghostbusters I and II. But instead of chasing ghost's we're chasing after rogue aliens.

James (Will Smith) is an officer in the NYPD and one of the top officers. After a hard night, James is questioned by his own police force for allegedly killing a suspect who fell off a building. As James insists that the person was acting strangely, Agent K (Tommmy Lee Jones) comes in and takes him out. 

James is welcomed to a secret agency which keeps aliens in check. After a brief examination of his life, James (now Agent J) joins the agency. On his first day, suddenly K and J are on a mission to stop a massive cockroach from destroying Earth and starting a galactic war. 

The chemistry between Smith and Jones is hilarious. Smith has some great comedy scenes especially when he is using his new weapon, the Noisy Crickett and him trying to deliver a baby squid type creature. The aliens are smart, their inventive, and their just plain fun when seeing how they identify themselves and hide their identities. The story is funny and will keep you laughing at almost every scene.

The presentation of aliens as everyday people trying to live normal lives in Manhattan is a lot more fun than the presentation of murderous aliens (Independence Day). Another great part is that the film isn't overblown with special effects of alien explosions and massive battles. Instead comedy and chemistry keeps this top comedy flowing. 

Men In Black. Starring: Will Smith, Tommy Lee Jones, Linda Fiorentino, and Rip Torn.

4 1/2 out of 5 Stars.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":543103,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.3},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Adventure","Comedy"],"datePublished":"1997-07-02","keywords":"alien,pantyhose,superhero,flying saucer,laser gun","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Theatrical Version","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1466737177","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTg1MDQ2MzU2MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMzQ0ODkyMzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTg1MDQ2MzU2MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMzQ0ODkyMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"A streetwise NYPD detective joins a secret organization that polices extraterrestrial affairs on Earth."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000169/","name":"Tommy Lee Jones"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000226/","name":"Will Smith"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000400/","name":"Linda Fiorentino"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001756/","name":"Barry Sonnenfeld"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0009119/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0108321/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0192384/","name":"Lowell Cunningham"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004412/","name":"Ed Solomon"}],"duration":"PT1H38M"}</script><metacontent="
